page.title: 09FRINTON LAWN TENNIS CLUB
page.content: {FRINTON TENNIS CLUB}WAS FOUNDED IN 1900 WHEN LAND WAS LEASED FOR Â£6:00 A YEAR, ON WHAT WAS ORIGINALLY FARM LAND.THE CLUB WAS VERY POPULAR DURING THE 1920'S AND 1930'S WHEN VISITORS INCLUDED THE PRINCE OF WALES, SIR WINSTON CHURCHILL AND DOUGLAS FAIRBANKS. TODAY THE TENNIS CLUB HAS 16 GRASS COURTS, 6 HARD WEATHER COURTS, 3 SQUASH COURTS AND 1 HEATED OPEN AIR SWIMMING POOL. TOURNAMENTS ARE HELD RIGHT THROUGH THE YEAR. IN JULY AND AUGUST THE L.T.A. AND JUNIOR L.T.A. TOURNAMENTS ARE HELD, ATTRACTING PLAYERS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD. A FAMILY PAY Â£252:00 FOR A YEAR FOR SPORTING MEMBERSHIP. IT COSTS AN ADULT Â£117:00 FOR THE SAME.
